speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, thank you, Brother Reynolds, for your inaugural ode, and may I congratulate you on your ingenuity in rhyming "Sauvignon" with "tie one on."

speaker: Reynolds
text: [_with a sycophantic salute_] Sir.

speaker: Niles
text: And now, as outgoing Corkmaster it is my privilege [_takes ribbon off_] to bestow the sash of office upon the newly- elected Corkmaster... which would be me! [_puts ribbon back on, to applause_] Thank you, thank you, thank you for your support.  It humbles me, and I only hope to live up to the shining example of my predecessor. [_laughter_] And of course the example of my opponent, the other brother Crane, who so graciously conceded after that fourth recount.  Is he - is he here?  I guess he's not.  Well, I'm sure he's with us in spirit.  Uh, if you'll indulge me, I've cobbled together a few remarks to express what this moment means to me- _Frasier clambers down the stairs, acting embarrassed but obviously making as much noise as he can._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry!  Oh God, I'm terribly sorry I'm late! Oh, it's just coming down in buckets out there!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier. [_resumes_] Just as the cork protects the wine, as Corkmaster I hope to protect the wine club from the forces of metaphorical oxidation-

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh lord, Niles, are you in the middle of your inauguration speech?  I'm so sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: That's all right, that's all right.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just that I have an announcement of my own to make.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes well, uh, new business is concluded, Brother Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: I move that we re-open new business.

speaker: Reynolds
text: Second.

speaker: Niles
text: Denied. [_bangs gavel_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Point of order: once a motion has been seconded, there must be a vote.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, all right, just tell us your new business.

speaker: Frasier
text: To override procedure, there must be a quorum.

speaker: Niles
text: Very well.  Move for a vote?

speaker: Reynolds
text: Second.

speaker: Niles
text: All in favor?

speaker: Members
text: Aye!

speaker: Niles
text: Motion carried. [_bangs gavel_] Secretary, make a note.

speaker: Reynolds
text: Noted, Corkmaster.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you so much. [_to Frasier_] Proceed.

speaker: Endicott
text: [_a member, to himself_] I remember when we used to come here to drink.

speaker: Frasier
text: Corkmaster, members of the wine cabinet, esteemed brothers and sisters, I come here tonight with a heavy heart.  You see, I am resigning from the wine club.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, this wouldn't have anything to do with my winning the election, would it?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, of course not, Niles, I couldn't be happier for you. You see, I've been afforded a marvelous opportunity to pass on what I've learned here to a much larger audience. Starting next week I will be hosting a new feature on KACL, called "the Wine Corner," just at the end of Gil Chesterton's "Restaurant Beat." [_applause_] Thank you, thank you.

speaker: Reynolds
text: Can't you do both?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, no, regrettably no.  You see, like this Camembert, I am at my most delicious when I'm not spread too thin. But this isn't goodbye by any stretch of the imagination. Please, I invite each and every one of you to call into my show, so that you can help me get Seattle hooked on our sometimes whimsical, always enlightened brand of discussion. But, I've taken enough time away from Niles.  After all, this is his night.  He has been elected Corkmaster of this fine club.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Frasier.  For a moment I thought you were settling in for a long farewell speech.

speaker: Reynolds
text: Second.

speaker: Frasier
text: All in favor?

speaker: Members
text: Aye!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if you insist! [_takes podium_] It was a short seven years ago, on a night very much like this one, a man had a dream... _Niles, swept to the side, morosely caresses his Corkmaster medal.  FADE OUT_  **OENOLOGY FOR DUMMIES**  _Scene Two -- KACL Frasier heads down the hall with Roz._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Roz, now this is a very different kind of show we're going to be doing, so are you clear on the procedure?

speaker: Roz
text: What's so hard?  You talk for a while, I screen calls, you answer them, I look interested -- oh, I see the hard part.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, ha-ha, very funny.  All right, now listen, this is a list of the members of the wine club. [_hands it to her_] If any of these names should happen to call, put them through immediately, and then fasten your seat belt for an all-out, free-wheeling symposium!

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, there's my Renaissance man!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Kenny!

speaker: Kenny
text: If he can't solve their problems with therapy, solve 'em with drinking!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, let's just keep that out of the ads, shall we?

speaker: Kenny
text: Heh-heh, too late!

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny!  _In the booth, Gil is doing his show with his new producer, an effeminate slip of a lad called Lance._

speaker: Gil
text: And finally, no review of Le Petite Oiseau would be complete without a word about their decor: hideous!  I'll be back after these messages.

speaker: Lance
text: [_singsong_] And we're out!

speaker: Kenny
text: Hi, Lance.  This is Frasier, and this is Roz.  She'll be producing the rest of the show.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi. [_extends her hand_]

speaker: Lance
text: Oh, my! [_ignores it_] Isn't that interesting?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes well, Frasier wants me to produce his segment of the show. We have to get the levels just right to accommodate the timbre of his voice.

speaker: Lance
text: Oh, my, my, my, isn't she the fusspot!

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, it was my idea.

speaker: Lance
text: That's who I was talking about!

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Gil, I-I hope you don't mind my doing this segment.

speaker: Gil
text: Oh, perish the thought!  I'm ecstatic - as ecstatic as you would be if someone hijacked the last fifteen minutes of your show.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey Gil, what is the deal with Lance?

speaker: Gil
text: Oh, smitten already, are we, Roz?  Well, he's certainly catnip to the ladies.

speaker: Roz
text: No, that would- [_confused_] Really?

speaker: Gil
text: Well, that's what he claims.  Of course, I've never actually seen him with a woman.  Well, just between us I've always thought he went the other way.

speaker: Roz
text: [_more confused_] Which way would that be?

speaker: Lance
text: And we're back!

speaker: Gil
text: [_into mike_] Normally at this time I'd be doing my segment on food for the calorie-conscious, "All Things Light and Edible." But apparently health is going to take a backseat to the random musings of a radio psychiatrist on wine.  So without further ado, I give you "The Wine Corner," with your host, Dr. Frasier Crane.  _Gil slaps his headphones down on the console and leaves the booth with Lance.  Frasier and Roz assume their positions._

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Gil, for that gracious introduction.  And hello, Seattle!  Welcome to "The Wine Corner."  I hope you're as excited about this new program as I am.  I offer myself as sherpa -- a guide, if you will, to lead you through the labyrinth of vintages and wine lists, chateaus and bodegas, and take you hopefully to a whole new level of sophistication... _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Three -- Fifteen minutes later. Frasier is wrapping up his segment.  The wind has all but gone out of his sails._

speaker: Frasier
text: In summary, Linda, the year listed on the bottle is not an expiration date.  So that wine from 1997 should be perfectly safe to drink. [_disconnects_] Who else, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: We have ten seconds, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: In that case, this is Frasier Crane, reminding you that a great wine is like a great woman: always intoxicating, ever-surprising, and only getting better with age.

speaker: Roz
text: Aww, do you really believe that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, who cares, Roz?  I stopped listening to myself ten minutes ago.  You're sure no one from the wine club called?

speaker: Roz
text: I'm positive.  Don't feel bad, you got a lot of other callers.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just that I was hoping to provoke the same kind of spirited debates we have at the wine club!  No holds barred free-for-alls!  Sometimes go into the wee hours of the night and even spill out into the streets. [_mournful_] Oh, Roz, we loved wine then.

speaker: Gil
text: Huzzah, Frasier!  I'm sure everyone who was listening is hitting the bottle as we speak.  Well, Lance and I are going for a boys' night out.

speaker: Lance
text: [_with a twirly hand motion_] Lock up your daughters!  _They leave.  FADE TO:  Scene Four -- Apartment Martin is in his Chair, reading the paper.  Frasier is at the dinner table with a laptop and a bottle of white wine.  He carefully takes a mouthful, swishes it around, then swallows and sucks in his breath sharply.  Then he types._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, tell me if you think this is too subtle for my listening audience. [_Martin puts his paper down_] "This delightful offering is infused with the brooding, almost dangerous, presence of vanilla."

speaker: Martin
text: No, it's not too subtle.  Unless you want them to know what the hell you're talking about.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you don't think it's clear that I enjoyed the wine?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't it's clear you're talking about wine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh lord, that'll be the new therapist.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, lucky me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh now, behave yourself, Dad.  It's only until Daphne comes back.  And besides, you have no idea how difficult it is to find a therapist who can also cook.  Her name is Frederika.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sounds German.  You know what that means -- she was probably kicked off the shotput team for using steroids.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now Dad, the Germans never threw anybody off the team for that.  _Frasier opens the door to Frederika -- a strapping German woman with blonde hair and a singsong accent._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, hello.

speaker: Frederika
text: Hi, I'm Frederika.

speaker: Frasier
text: Won't you come in? [_she does_] Here, let me take your bag. I'm Dr. Frasier Crane, and this is my father, Martin. Here, let me take your coat. [_he does_]

speaker: Frederika
text: Pleasure to meet you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, my father's been, well, letting his exercises slide a bit.

speaker: Frederika
text: Oh well, that's human nature, Dr. Crane.  People neglect their exercising for many reasons -- holidays, travel, illness, lack  of time, death... and there's only one of those excuses that I accept: it's holidays! [_laughs_] Oh, it's just your leg I'm pulling!

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs_] Oh, well, good one.  You know, I was worried that you were going to be one of those drill-sergeant types.

speaker: Frederika
text: You'll show me your exercise mat.

speaker: Martin
text: That's my other leg you're pulling, huh?

speaker: Frederika
text: Now!  _Martin obeys, leading her to his room.  She follows with a strange, undulating walk.  Frasier returns to the table._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, yes... [_sips, swishes, and sucks again; typing_] "But discernible only to the educated palate is the hint of violets that lingers like a haunting refrain..." _From Martin's room comes a howl of agony, as if from a heretic on the Rack.  Frasier runs toward the hall when Frederika comes out._

speaker: Frederika
text: Shame on you, Dr. Crane!  You really should have kept him at his exercises.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is he all right?

speaker: Frederika
text: No, indeed!  He is shamefully out of shape!

speaker: Frasier
text: But I meant-

speaker: Frederika
text: But don't worry.  I got here just in time.  I'll shape him up, or know the reason why! _She goes back into the hall.  Frasier, worried, is about to follow her, but then the phone rings._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Oh yes, thank you for returning my call, Brother Peabody.  Yes well, I'm just wondering, how come none of the members have been calling my wine show? [_shocked_] No! Well, just because Niles is Corkmaster, it doesn't mean he has the right to dictate whom you may and may not call! Good lord, the man is my own brother!  How can someone turn his back on his own flesh and blood- [_Martin screams even louder_] Someone on the phone here! **WHINE CLUB**  _Scene Five -- Wine Club Niles is holding court._

speaker: Members
text: Aye!

speaker: Niles
text: It is so resolved, [_bangs gavel_] any other business?

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, former Brother Crane, what are you doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know very well.  How dare you instruct the members not to call in to my radio show?

speaker: Niles
text: [_indignant_] I simply directed their attention to Law 10-C, which states that the club "shall not, through contract or deed, endorse-"

speaker: Frasier
text: [_with him_] "Any commercial endeavor," yes, yes, Niles, you can hide behind some flimsy bylaw if you wish to for as long as you like, but we both know the subtext behind this pretext: vindictiveness!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!

speaker: Frasier
text: In light of this abuse of power, I move that the Corkmaster be stripped of his title! [_gasps from the members_] And that some more well-deserving member be named in his stead!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, the motion fails for lack of a second.

speaker: Reynolds
text: Second.

speaker: Niles
text: Stop that!  Motion denied. [_bangs gavel_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Point of order: a motion cannot be denied that has been seconded!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes well, the chair doesn't recognize motions from former members, ergo there can be no second to a motion that doesn't exist!

speaker: Endicott
text: I move whatever it takes to get us to the bar!

speaker: Reynolds
text: Second that.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, the chair declares a state of emergency and a five-second recess. [_bangs gavel_] Frasier, I want you out of here.  It's bad enough you upstaged me the other night.

speaker: Frasier
text: I did no such thing.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, _no_ , you could have picked any time to announce your resignation, but you chose my inauguration to do it!

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sakes, Niles, will you listen to yourself! This is just a wine club!

speaker: Niles
text: "Just a wine club?"  That's not the platform you campaigned on two years in a row!  Look, you can say anything you want now, you know how important this place is to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and you know how important my radio show is to me.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh well, I guess then we're even.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you admit it.  You have dishonored this club with your selfishness!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes well, at least I'm still _in_ the club!  You are a trespasser!  Sergeant-at-Arms! _Virgil Hepplewhite, the club's elderly founder, rises slowly to his feet and hobbles over to Frasier._

speaker: Hepplewhite
text: We can do this the easy way or the hard way.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic_] All right, call off your henchmen.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, stand down, Brother Hepplewhite.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm just trying to save you from yourself, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: I see, well, goodbye, _former_ Brother.

speaker: Frasier
text: You took the words right out of my mouth!  _Frasier leaves.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Six -- Apartment Martin is tucking into a plate of German roast, with a glass stein of beer next to his plate.  Frasier shuffles in, seemingly at a loss._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Anything good on TV tonight?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know, why?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, got the night free.  Thought we might hang out together.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh... that's nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, I usually have wine club on Wednesday nights.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.

speaker: Frasier
text: What do you usually do Wednesday nights?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, just sit back, enjoy the silence.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sounds good.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_checks his watch_] Seven-thirty... wonder what they're doing at the wine club right now.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, jeez.  Are you gonna do this all night?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Dad, you're right, I-I'm sorry.  It's just that I hate to see a once-proud institution making so many foolish mistakes.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if it makes you feel any better, the club'll probably fail without you.  It'll be no fun.  All the members'll resign.  This time next month, they'll probably have torn the building down.

speaker: Frasier
text: I never know when you're being facetious.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, you do.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right, let's talk about something else. How's your physical therapy?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it was the most painful afternoon of my life.  She did things to me.  Bad things.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Dad, I suppose we could look for another therapist-

speaker: Martin
text: Whup, hold on a second!  Here, [_takes a forkful of food from his plate_] try this.

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, that sauerbrauten is ambrosial!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, and wait 'til you wash it down with her papa's homemade lager! [_takes a drink of beer_]

speaker: Frederika
text: How is everything?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gosh, Frederika, I've never tasted anything so divine!

speaker: Frederika
text: Oh, _ja_ , you see, Dr. Crane, I don't believe that fitness depends on starving yourself.  The secret is exercise, hard work, then good food and lots of it when you've earned it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, this is fabulous food-

speaker: Frederika
text: You haven't earned it!

speaker: Frederika
text: That's just my way of having fun!  Of course you're welcome, I'll get another plate.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  _She goes back to the kitchen.  Frasier is still rubbing his cheek, trying to get some feeling back in it._

speaker: Martin
text: We ought to get Niles over here, you know?  He'd love this stuff!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles -- Dad, I told you Niles is no longer welcome in this house. [_Frederika brings him a plate_] Thank you, Frederika.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh son, why don't you just ask your brother to take you back?

speaker: Frasier
text: I did.  I called him and I apologized.  He would hear none of it.  All he did was keep quoting rules and bylaws.

speaker: Martin
text: It's just like when you were kids with that fort!  You were always making up these big fancy rules and titles for yourself that always ended up in a fight!  I didn't like it then, and I don't like it now.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Dad, then we just won't talk about it.  Besides, I'm through with wine club.

speaker: Martin
text: Good!  Why don't we just enjoy our Wednesday?

speaker: Frasier
text: Second! [_to himself_] All in favor... aye... motion carried. [_off Martin's look_] I'm done now. _FADE TO:  Scene Seven -- Wine Club Niles and other members are standing around, tasting wine._

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm, mmm-hmm, mmm-hmm.  I'm getting oak with plummy overtones.

speaker: Endicott
text: I'm getting screwed on alimony.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, I want to talk to you.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad!  What happened, is there something wrong?

speaker: Martin
text: You're damn right there is, it's about you and Frasier! [_notices_] Good God, you wear a sash?!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier sent you down here, didn't he?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s. from above_] No!

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, get in here now! _Frasier shuffles in beside Niles.  The following scene is weirdly similar to a father dressing down two toddlers -- a spectacle that both Frasier and Niles are desperate to avoid._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, this isn't necessary.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, we-we can talk about this some other time.

speaker: Martin
text: Zip it up, both of you!  I just gave up the best meal of my life to come down here, so listen up.  Niles, let your brother play.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, this is not a game, this is a club, and Frasier broke the rules!

speaker: Frasier
text: Technically, I-

speaker: Martin
text: [_silences him_] Well, then you write a new rule so that Frasier can come back.

speaker: Frasier
text: First, I want an apology-

speaker: Martin
text: I said zip it!

speaker: Niles
text: He did, I heard him!

speaker: Martin
text: Don't get smart!  Now, are you gonna let your brother play?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad-

speaker: Martin
text: Are you gonna let your brother play?

speaker: Niles
text: Why-

speaker: Martin
text: Are you gonna let your brother play?

speaker: Niles
text: I-

speaker: Martin
text: Are you gonna let your brother play?

speaker: Niles
text: Fine.

speaker: Martin
text: Am I gonna have any more trouble between you two?

speaker: Frasier/Niles
text: [_humble_] No.

speaker: Martin
text: No, what?

speaker: Frasier/Niles
text: No, sir.

speaker: Martin
text: Good.  Now shake hands. [_they do_] That's more like it.  Now if you don't mind, I've got a big plate of _Gew�rzpl�tzchen_ waiting for me at home with my name on it.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, well, [_chuckles_] let's get back to the wine, shall we?

speaker: Reynolds
text: You got yelled at by your dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, be that as it may-

speaker: Endicott
text: Zip it!  _Everyone laughs louder.  FADE TO:  Scene Eight -- Apartment Frasier opens the door to Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.  I thought we could drive over to wine club together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I'm thinking about not going.

speaker: Niles
text: Why not?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, truth be told, my enthusiasm for the wine club has started to turn.

speaker: Niles
text: I know what you mean!  It used to be the wine club.  Now it's just the teasing people club.

speaker: Frasier
text: Then let's not go.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, they'll put our names in the Absent bottle, we'll have to bring the crackers next time.

speaker: Frasier
text: What if there's no next time?

speaker: Niles
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, those people don't care about wine.

speaker: Niles
text: Not the way you and I do, no!

speaker: Frasier
text: So what's preventing us from starting a whole new club from scratch?

speaker: Niles
text: We could really get back to basics!

speaker: Frasier
text: Something that's just about wine!  And a clear constitutional procedure for enjoying it!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, only maybe this time the governing body could be bicameral!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know, Niles, there is something to be said for the parliamentary system!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, either way we have to have a strong judiciary to keep it in check.

speaker: Frasier
text: God, I love wine.
